alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:36PM AKST until February 22 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Total snowfall 4 to 8 inches. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Highway summits will have winds gusting to 25 mph and low visibility in blowing snow. * WHERE...Fairbanks north. * WHEN...3 PM today to 6 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow will develop north of Fairbanks and spread south to Fairbanks about midnight. Areas north of Fairbanks can expect 5 to 8 inches of snow. Fairbanks can expect 4 inches of snow, with most of the snow falling from midnight tonight through noon on Tuesday. Areas south of Fairbanks such as North Pole can expect 2 inches of snow. Highway summits will have winds gusting to 25 mph and low visibility in blowing snow. Snow will taper off Tuesday afternoon and winds over summits will taper off Tuesday evening. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
